Label: 1D Coordinate System
Definition: Non-repeating sequence of coordinate system axes that spans a given coordinate space in one dimension

Label: 3D Coordinate System
Definition: Non-repeating sequence of coordinate system axes that spans a given coordinate space in three dimensions

Label: Coordinate System
Definition: Set of axes that spans a given coordinate space and of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.2, table 17 and annex B.2.
Definition 1 IGN: Set of axes that spans a given coordinate space and of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.2, table 17 and annex B.2.
Definition 2 ISO: set of mathematical rules for specifying how coordinates are to be assigned to points

Label: Affine Coordinate System
Definition: Coordinate system in Euclidean space with straight axes that are not necessarily mutually perpendicular
Definition 2 ISO: coordinate system in Euclidean space with straight axes that are not necessarily mutually perpendicular

Core Class?: Can’t find it in ISO RDF
Can’t find it in ISO RDF

Label: Barycentric Coordinate System
Definition: A coordinate system in which the location of a point is specified by reference to a simplex (a triangle for points in a plane, a tetrahedron for points in three-dimensional space, etc.)

Label: Cartesian Coordinate System
Definition: Coordinate system which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular axes. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 18.
Definition 1 IGN: Coordinate system which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular axes. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 18.
Definition 2 ISO: coordinate system in Euclidean space which gives the position of points relative to n mutually perpendicular straight axes all having the same unit of measure

Label: Celestial Coordinate System
Definition: A coordinate system for specifying positions of celestial objects relative to physical reference points

Label: Conical Coordinate System
Definition: A conical coordinate system is a three-dimensional orthogonal coordinate system consisting of concentric spheres (described by their radius r) and by two families of perpendicular cones, aligned along the z- and x-axes, respectively

Label: Curvilinear Coordinate System
Definition: A coordinate system for the Euclidean space in which the coordinate lines may be curved

Label: Cylindrical Coordinate System
Definition: Three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by two linear coordinates and one angular coordinate
Definition 2 ISO: three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by two linear coordinates and one angular coordinate

Label: Ecliptic Coordinate System
Definition: An ecliptic coordinate system is used for representing the apparent positions and orbits of solar system objects.

Label: Ellipsoidal Coordinate System
Definition: Coordinate system which gives the position is specified by geodetic latitude, geodetic longitude and (in the three-dimensional case) ellipsoidal height. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 20.
Definition 1 IGN: Coordinate system which gives the position is specified by geodetic latitude, geodetic longitude and (in the three-dimensional case) ellipsoidal height. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 20.

Label: Engineering Coordinate System
Definition: Coordinate system used by an engineering coordinate reference system, one of an affine coordinate system, a Cartesian coordinate system, a cylindrical coordinate system, a linear coordinate sytem, an ordinal coordinate system, a polar coordinate system or a spherical coordinate system

Label: Equatorial Coordinate System
Definition: A celestial coordinate system in which an object's position on the celestial sphere is described in terms of its north-south declination and east-west right ascension, measured relative to the celestial equator and vernal equinox, respectively.

Label: Galactic Coordinate System
Definition: A coordinate system with the Sun as its center, the primary direction aligned with the approximate center of the Milky Way Galaxy, and the fundamental plane parallel to an approximation of the galactic plane but offset to its north.

Label: Geodetic Coordinate System
Definition: Coordinate system used by a Geodetic CRS, one of a Cartesian coordinate system or a spherical coordinate system.

Label: Geographic Coordinate System
Definition: Spherical or geodetic coordinate system for measuring and communicating positions directly on Earth as latitude and longitude.

Label: Grid Coordinate System
Definition: A grid coordinate system identifies areas within a grid.

Label: Hexagonal Coordinate System
Definition: A hexagonal coordinate system identifies areas within a hexagonal lattice.

Label: Horizontal Coordinate System
Definition: A horizontal coordinate system is a celestial coordinate system that uses the observer's local horizon as the fundamental plane.

Label: Linear Coordinate System
Definition: One-dimensional coordinate system in which a linear feature forms the axis.
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system in which a linear feature forms the axis

Label: Local Coordinate System
Definition: Coordinate system with a point of local reference.

Label: Oblique Coordinate System
Definition: A plane coordinate system whose axes are not perpendicular.

Label: Ordinal Coordinate System
Definition: n-dimensional coordinate system in which every axis uses integers.
Definition 2 ISO: n-dimensional coordinate system in which every axis uses integers. Note: The number of associations shall be equal the dimension of the coordinate system.

Label: Orthogonal Coordinate System
Definition: A orthogonal coordinate system is a system of curvilinear coordinates in which each family of surfaces intersects the others at right angles.

Label: Parametric Coordinate System
Definition: One-dimensional coordinate system where the axis units are parameter values which are not inherently spatial.
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system where the axis units are parameter values which are not inherently spatial

Label: Perifocal Coordinate System
Definition: A frame of reference centered at the focus of the orbit, i.e. the celestial body about which the orbit is centered.

Label: Planar Coordinate System
Definition: A two-dimensional measurement system that locates features on a plane based on their distance from an origin (0,0) along two perpendicular axes.

Label: Polar Coordinate System
Definition: Two-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by one distance coordinate and one angular coordinate.
Definition 2 ISO: two-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by the distance from the origin and the angle between the line from the origin to a point and a reference directionNote: A PolarCS shall have two axis associations.

Label: Skew Coordinate System
Definition: A skew coordinate system is a system of curvilinear coordinates in which each family of surfaces intersects the others at angles other than right angles.

Label: Spherical Coordinate System
Definition: Three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space with one distance measured from the origin and two angular coordinates
Definition 2 ISO: three-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by one distance coordinate and two angular coordinates

Label: DateTime Temporal Coordinate System
Definition: One-dimensional coordinate system used to record time in dateTime representation as defined in ISO 8601.

Label: Temporal Count Coordinate System
Definition: One-dimensional coordinate system used to record time as an integer count.
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system used to record time as an integer countNote: A TemporalCountCS shall have one axis association.

Label: Temporal Coordinate System
Definition: One-dimensionalcoordinate system where the axis is time.
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system where the axis is time

Label: Temporal Measure Coordinate System
Definition: One-dimensional coordinate system used to record a time as a real number.
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system used to record a time as a real numberNote: A TemporalMeasureCS shall have one axis association.

Label: Super Galactic Coordinate System
Definition: A reference frame for the supercluster of galaxies that contains the Milky Way galaxy, referenced to a local relatively flat collection of galaxy clusters used to define the supergalactic plane.

Label: Vertical Coordinate System
Definition: One-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity related height or depth measurements. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 25.
Definition 1 IGN: One-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity related height or depth measurements. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 15 and 25.
Definition 2 ISO: one-dimensional coordinate system used for gravity-related height or depth measurements
two-dimensional coordinate system in Euclidean space in which position is specified by one distance coordinate and one angular coordinate

Label: Coordinate System Axis
Definition: Axis relative to which a coordinate of a point is specified in a coordinate system. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.3, table 27 and annex B.2.2.
Definition 1 IGN: Axis relative to which a coordinate of a point is specified in a coordinate system. See ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, part 9.3, table 27 and annex B.2.2.
